results.title: Noah's Ark (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Bill Justice
results.brief_description: An updated version of the story of Noah’s Ark, which will trigger children’s interest in biblical stories and initiate classroom discussion. The film is inventive in its use of three-dimensional animation techniques that would be of special interest to film study classes.

results.title: Noah's ark
results.creator_credit: Stephen Jones, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and John irvin
results.brief_description: Australia provides the backdrop for this loose retelling of the eternal story of biblical hero Noah (Jon Voight), the great flood that destroyed the world, and the ark that was built by Noah and his family and housed two of every animal species. This made for television movie was not well received by critics, despite its international cast of Jon Voight, Mary Steenburgen and F. Murray Abraham.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Jones, Babelsberg International Film Produktion and John irvin

results.title: No.1 = Number one
results.brief_description: Presented as a visual essay, without commentary, this film concentrates on the physical movements of a top German soccer goal-keeper in a straight time series from an actual game, through training to the big match.

results.title: No. 1 On the Charts : A Look at the Australian Pop Music Industry
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions, David Ferris, Trevor Lunn and Don Fitzsimmons
results.brief_description: Lee Simon, Basia Bonkowski, Jane Clifton and Michael Gudinski are interviewed in a forum style program about their views on the presentation of popular culture in the media. Video clips are interposed throughout the program.

results.title: No. 1 hits of the 60's (1965-1969)
results.creator_credit: Cyriel Van Den Heme and Cable Connections
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Rock n’ roll: the greatest years”.
This tape provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. Songs on the tape include: “Stars on 45”, Stars on 45: ‘Mr Tambourine man”, The Byrds: “I got you babe”, Sonny & Cher: “These boots are made for walking”, Nancy Sinatra: “The Sun ain’t gonna shine anymore”, Walker Brothers: “All or nothing”, Small Faces: “Good vibrations”, Beach Boys: “Whiter shade of pale”, Procol Harum: “Mighty Quinn”, Manfred Mann: “Cinderella Rockafella”, Esther & Obi Ofarim: “Baby come back”, Equals: “Fire”, Arthur Brown: “Those were the days”, Mary Hopkin: “Albatross”, Fleetwood Mac: “(If paradise is) half as nice”, Amen Corner: “In the year 2525”, Zager & Evans: “Something in the air”, Thunderclap Newman.

This tape provides a nostalgic compilation of classics from the era, smattered with a healthy dose of gossip surrounding the performers. Songs on the tape include: “Stars on 45”, Stars on 45: “Only the lonely”, Roy Orbison: “Walk right back”, Everly Brothers: “The Young ones”, Cliff Richard: “Diamonds”, Jet Harris: “I Like it”, Gerry & the Pacemakers: “Do you love me?”, Brian Poole & Tremeloes: “Needles & pins”, Searchers: “World without love”, Peter & Gordon: “Juliet”, Four Pennies: “House of the rising sun”, Animals: “Have I the right”, Honeycombes: “You really got me”, Kinks: “I’m into something good”, Hermans Hermits: “Oh pretty woman”, Roy Orbison: “Go now”, Moody Blues: “You’ve lost that loving feeling”, Righteous Brothers: “I’m alive”, The Hollies.

results.title: No worries
results.creator_credit: Palm Beach Pictures, Initial (GB), Southern Star Entertainment, David Elfick and Eric Fellner
results.brief_description: The courage of Ben and Ellen Beel and their 11-year-old daughter, Matilda, has seen them through countless misfortunes in a country plagued by the harsh elements. Drought is again parching the Australian outback with devastating consequences, and having barely survived the recession of the early 1990’s, the Bells now face an ever tumbling wool price dwindling their profits and their sheep dying of starvation. When all seems lost and they must leave their beloved home to move to the city, the never-say-die Aussie spirit triumphs - no worries!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Palm Beach Pictures, Initial (GB), Southern Star Entertainment, David Elfick and Eric Fellner

When all seems lost and they must leave their beloved home to move to the city, the never-say-die Aussie spirit triumphs - no worries!

results.title: No way to forget (A)
results.brief_description: Based on Richard Frankland’s experiences as a field officer during the Royal Commission into Aboriginal custody, this film follows the journey of Shane as he drives from Swan Hill to Melbourne after a day in the field. During the night, his experiences play on his mind and imagination. He will be haunted by what he has seen.
